apps.name: Twitter
apps.description: Embed lists of recent tweets or individual tweets from Twitter. Lists can be derived from search results, or from a user's twitter feed. Individual tweets require the tweet ID.

apps.name: Public Collections
apps.description: Browse or search through multiple content repositories including MIT OCW, Khan Academy, USA Today, etc.

apps.name: Graph Builder
apps.description: Graph builder lets you define graphs based on simple or complex equations and chart them dynamically. Zoom and move the graph around and then embed it into course content.
apps.short_description: Build and embed rich interactive graphs into course content

apps.name: OCW Search
apps.description: OCW search collects OCW courses from MIT, Stanford, Yale, the Open University, etc. for searching and linking.

apps.name: Status.net
apps.description:
Status.net is a private microblogging platform that can be run for your institution, department or course. This app allows for auto-login to the Status.net system from course content or course navigation.

NOTE: This app will only work when set to open in a new tab, it will not work in an embedded iframe.

Directions for configuring Status.net:
  1. Configure your Status.net instance
  2. Download the Status.net LTI plugin
  3. Extract the LTI plugin into Status.net's plugins folder
  4. Edit config.php and add

    addPlugin('LTIAuthentication', array('provider_name'=>'LTI'));

  5. Edit BLTI/IMSBasicLTI/configuration/authorizedConsumersKey.cfg, adding the following lines:

    consumer_key.<consumer_key>.enabled=1
    consumer_key.<consumer_key>.secret=<password>

  6. For more detailed configuration, follow the directions here

apps.name: Question2Answer
apps.description:
Question2Answer is an open source Q&A site. You could use it to host course or institution-level Q&A services. This app allows for auto-login to the Question2Answer platform from another system. Links can be added to course content, or optionally as course navigation.

Directions for configuring Question2Answer:
  1. Configure your Question2Answer instance
  2. Download the Q2A LTI plugin
  3. Extract the LTI plugin into Q2A's main folder
  4. Log as administrator, go to Administration center - Plugins
  5. Click over 'options'
  6. Configure BasicLTI Settings:
    1. Enable Plugin
    2. Disable Default BLTI Username: You have to define the parameter of basic lti with the custom username instead of the default BasicLTI Parameter
    3. Parameter Username: If you enabled Disable BLTI Username you have to indicate the custom username, usuarlly is custom_username
    4. Logout URL: Full url (include http://) to logout from the SSO and this Q2A application
    5. New user message: Optional. Message shown to new users when they login for the first time.
  7. Edit BLTI/IMSBasicLTI/configuration/authorizedConsumersKey.cfg, adding the following lines:

    consumer_key.<consumer_key>.enabled=1
    consumer_key.<consumer_key>.secret=<password>

  8. For more detailed configuration, follow the directions here

apps.name: Wikispaces Private Label
apps.description:
This tool lets teachers link to a Wikispaces Private Label wiki within the course environment, providing seamless user account generation and single-sign on to class members. Students clicking the Wikispaces tool link will be automatically authenticated (and registered as a user) on the WikiSpaces wiki account, giving them viewing and editing abilities.

Note that a paid Wikispaces Private Label account is required to use this tool.

Before adding this tool, you'll need to first set up Basic LTI in your Wikispaces Private Label Site Administration Settings as described on the WikiSpaces Basic LTI Help page. This will let you choose Basic LTI as an authentication method.
apps.short_description: Wikspaces Private Label LTI tool links to a wiki within the course environment, providing seamless user account generation and single-sign on to class members.

apps.name: Wiktionary
apps.description: Search through English Wiktionary definitions and insert definitions into course material.

apps.name: Mahara
apps.description:
Mahara is an open source ePortfolio and social networking tool. This app allows for auto-login to the Mahara platform from another system. Links can be added to course content, or optionally as course navigation.

Directions for configuring Mahara:
  1. Configure your Mahara instance
  2. Download the Mahara LTI plugin
  3. Extract the LTI plugin into Mahara's auth folder
  4. Go to Admin home - Extensions - Plugin Administration - Plugin type: auth
  5. Enable 'blti'
  6. For more detailed configuration, follow the directions here

apps.name: WordPress
apps.description:
WordPress is a blogging and publishing platform. You can use it to host student or class blogs. This app allows for auto-login to the WordPress platform. Links can be added to course content, or optionally as course navigation.

Directions for configuring WordPress:
  1. Configure your WordPress account for multisite
  2. Download the WordPress LTI plugin
  3. Extract the LTI plugin into wp-content/mu-plugin
  4. Log as superAdmin and go to Network Dashboard -> Settings -> LTI Consumers Keys. Here you can manage the authorized consumers keys
  5. For more detailed configuration, follow the directions here

apps.name: Khan Academy
apps.description:
Search for and embed Khan Academy lessons and exercise into course material. Khan Academy focuses on short lessons on math, science, etc. Uses the embedded player so students earn points for watching videos.

Currently no search functionality is provided through the Khan Academy API so we can't add search, but once that's supported on their side we'll definitely add it.
apps.short_description: Online video lessons for math, science, etc.

apps.name: Piazza
apps.description:
Piazza is a new style of discussion/Q&A site with a focus on educational institutions. This integration adds a link to the course navigation for Piazza discussions, and auto-logs the user into the course discussions area.

Contact Piazza for instructions on getting a consumer key and secret.

apps.name: TED Ed
apps.description:
TED Ed is a collection of quality videos that can be used for instructional purposes. This app lets you search for and embed TED Ed vidoes in your course material.

There are a bunch of activities and additional resources provided as part of TED Ed that we don't have API access to right now, so we can't share. Hopefully in the future that will change, because there's some nice flipped classroom content available on their site..

apps.name: Mathalicious
apps.description: Mathalicious develops high-quality, standards-based math videos and lessons aligned to Common Core standards. Videos can be linked to from any course content. Requires a Mathalicious subscription.

apps.name: Slideshare
apps.description:
Slideshare is a site that enables viewing and interacting with presentations without needing desktop software. Search for and embed Creative Commons-licensed presentations hosted on Slideshare.

Currently this app doesn't support user logins, so it only allows searching public slideshares. If there's a lot of interest we could consider adding that in the future...

apps.name: TitanPad
apps.description: TitanPad offers free, public collaborative documents based on EtherPad. Every placement of a TitanPad in your content will result in a new pad being created. Students can also chat while working together on a pad.

apps.name: YouTube
apps.description:
Search publicly available YouTube videos. A new icon will show up in your course rich editor letting you search YouTube and click to embed videos in your course material.

Shows the first 16 results for any keyword, and you can click any video to select it or embed it into your course material.

apps.name: Quizlet Flash Cards
apps.description:
Search for and embed publicly available flashcards and question sets from Quizlet. Questions can be embedded directly into content as flash cards, review, or as a study game.

Please note this tool does not utilize Quizlet’s login capabilities so it will only search content that has been publicly available.

The tool is very easy to set up and only requires the configuration URL. Once added to a course, you'll find a Quizlet button in your content editor that allows you to search the Quizlet public collections. Once a Quizlet is found, simply click on “Add Quizlet” to embed the flashcards directly within the content.
apps.short_description: Flash card and study help tools

apps.name: Internet Archive
apps.description: The Internet Archive hosts public domain video, audio, books, images and other resources. Links to any of these resources can easily be added to any course content.

apps.name: CK-12
apps.description:
CK-12 provides openly licensed and freely available textbooks and multimedia learning materials aimed primarily at grades K-12. This tool helps teachers search for and insert links to CK-12 materials (currently entire books or individual chapters) without leaving the LMS.

This tool does not require a paid service, and anything can be used for the shared secret and key

apps.name: McGraw Hill Tegrity
apps.description: Supports course-level access for the Tegrity lecture capture solution. Visit the Tegrity web site for instructions on how to sign up and get a consumer key and shared secret.

apps.name: Nook Study
apps.description:
The Nook Study Basic LTI tool makes it easy for teachers to search for and then link to Nook Study reading materials or textbooks.

Directions for obtaining a key and secret on the Nook Study LTI site
apps.short_description: The Nook Study tool makes it easy for teachers to search for and link to reading materials or textbooks.

apps.name: Campus Pack
apps.description:
Load Campus Pack inside the LMS to add ePortfolios, blogs, wikis, etc.

Directions for configuring Campus Pack:
  1. Login to Campus Pack as an administrator.
  2. Click Administrator Portal.
  3. Click External System Connectors.
  4. Click Create.
  5. Click Basic LTI Tool Producer.
  6. Fill out the form. These values will be important later.
    1. Set Connector Id to blti-producer.
    2. Set Name to your institution name.
    3. Do not alter Shared Secret Key.
    4. Ignore URL.
    5. Ignore IP address.
  7. Click Submit.

apps.name: Courseload
apps.description:
Courseload enables students and instructors to access their course eTextbooks directly within their courses without the need to login with separate credentials.

Courseload includes tools for highlighting, annotation, collaboration, search and evaluation that can be used across content from multiple sources to enhance teaching and learning experience. Courseload’s faculty dashboard enables new ways to teach and understand how students learn with real-time analytics and note sharing.

Click the Support link located on this page to contact Courseload for configuration assistance.

apps.name: MyOpenMath
apps.description:
Internet Math Assessment System lets you create and administer auto-graded math assessments to students. It has experimental support for passing grades back to the LMS.

Visit the web site for instructions on how to sign up and get a consumer key and shared secret.

apps.name: ChemVantage
apps.description:
Lets teachers build and distribute science education focused homework, video lectures, graded quizzes, etc.

Contact admin@chemvantage.org about getting a consumer key and shared secret.

apps.name: Panopto
apps.description:
The Panopto tool streamlines lecture capture by seamlessly authenticating users into Panopto. This tool can be launched either from within course content or as a course-level navigation option, giving role-based options to the user. Students can browse recorded lectures associated with the course; teachers can start a new Panopto lecture capture without leaving the LMS.

This tool requires a Panopto paid subscription. Panopto will provide institutional administrators with the necessary shared secret and consumer key in order to set up of this tool.

apps.name: Sage
apps.description:
Sage is an online open source mathematics software system, an alternative to Mathematica or Matlab. Users can build interactive mathematical systems that are rendered in the browser.

Once the app is installed, you can add the app to your course content and launch it, then start building out your visualizations to be reviewed by students.

apps.name: SchoolTube
apps.description:
SchoolTube is a public, searchable collection of videos uploaded from schools. Videos can be inserted as links or embedded in course material. It is the nation's largest K-12 moderated video sharing platform, specifically designed for students and educators - exclusively endorsed by over twenty national education associations.

SchoolTube is an excellent alternative for schools who may be restricting YouTube through their firewall or simply want to limit their search to content that has been created by schools.

Once the tool is configured, a new button is seen in the LMS’s Content Editor. Simply search for your video, click on the desired result and the resulting video is automatically linked with the content you are currently creating.

apps.name: Noteflight
apps.description:
Create, share and playback musical scores on the web. Perfect for teaching music in both the classroom and remotely. Use Noteflight to create and share music assignments with students instantly.

You'll need to sign up for noteflight and contact them to get your key and secret.

apps.name: CourseSmart
apps.description:
Provides faculty and students with direct access to their personalized CourseSmart Bookshelf and individual eTextbooks from within the environment they use daily.

Students benefit from search within a single book or across an entire stack; highlighting and note-taking; cut and paste as well as email sections, notes and highlighted text; selective printing; and page fidelity and preservation.

Faculty benefit from the Faculty Instant Access Program to streamline discovery, evaluation and adoption of course materials with single-sign-on access to the CourseSmart catalog. Faculty can embed digital learning materials as well as deep link to specific sections or pages.

Click the Support link located on this page to contact CourseSmart for configuration assistance.

apps.name: Storify
apps.description: Storify lets users organize events from across the web into a single cohesive "story". Adding this app allows you to search through and link to social stories from within your course material.
apps.short_description: Search and link to social stories

apps.name: Cengage Learning
apps.description:
Build and link to interactive educational content called MindLinks, provided by Cengage. MindLinks can deliver reading material, quizzes, activities, etc.

Contact Cengage to receive a consumer key and secret.

apps.name: Elgg
apps.description:
Open source social networking. You can add a link to your course navigation that will send users to an Elgg network already logged in.

You need to have a running Elgg server, and then you'll need to install the LTI plugin for Elgg in order for this integration to work.

apps.name: PlaceKitten
apps.description: PlaceKitten lets you embed perfectly-size kitten images into any online content. You pick the dimensions, whether it's color or grayscale, and then embed it into your content.

apps.name: Wikipedia
apps.description: Search through English Wikipedia articles and link to or embed these articles into course material.

apps.name: Merlot
apps.description: DISABLED DUE TO TAKE-DOWN NOTICE FROM MERLOT FOR VIOLATION OF TERMS OF USE Search through and insert links to multimedia resources curated and collected by MERLOT. This collection is only a subset of some of the higher-rated resources from MERLOT. For the full list of resources, please visit merlot.org.

apps.name: Inigral Schools App
apps.description:
Schools App is a private social network within Facebook for colleges and universities. Links to a school's app can be launched from within a course, and can also be added as a link that students will see in their user profile.

To set up you'll need to have an existing partnership with Inigral, and they will provide you with the app name to enter in the configuration.

apps.name: Hoot.me
apps.description:
Hoot.me lets students study and work collaboratively from within Facebook or the LMS. Includes text chat, video chat and Q&A features.

Contact hoot.me for instructions on how to configure.

apps.name: Smarterer
apps.description: Search through and insert links to quizzing and learning resources hosted by Smarterer

apps.name: Hooda Math
apps.description: Link to any of the math-related games hosted on Hooda Math's web site.

apps.name: educreations
apps.description: Educreations users "record" whiteboard sessions as short online lessons using their iPad. Browse and link to any of the publibly available lessons.

apps.name: College Board
apps.description: Makes it easy for instructors to browse the list of available practice resources for SAT and AP exams provided by the College Board. Any of these resources can be linked to within course material.
apps.short_description: Links to SAT and AP practice tests

apps.name: StudyEgg
apps.description: StudyEgg offers customized lessons using online video and questions.

apps.name: Google Art Project
apps.description:
This tool allows users to search for and embed Google Art Project resources into content pages or as stand-alone assets in modules or lessons.

Google has partnered with hundreds of museums, cultural institutions, and archives to host the world’s cultural treasures online through the Google Art Project. Here you can find artworks, landmarks and world heritage sites, as well as digital exhibitions that tell the stories behind the archives of cultural institutions across the globe.
apps.short_description: Digital tours of famous museum artwork

apps.name: Codecademy
apps.description: Online interactive tutorials to help learn computer programming. Lessons are taught using JavaScript and provide immediate feedback. Link to any Codecademy lessons from within your course.

apps.name: MIT OCW
apps.description: MIT OpenCourseWare is a collection of materials from MIT-taught courses that have been released with a Creative Commons license. Browse and link to materials from these collections within your course.
apps.short_description: OCW lectures, videos, etc. from MIT

apps.name: Flat World Knowledge
apps.description: Flat World Knowledge offers free, open-licensed textbooks that can be used in class material. Link to any of these textbooks from within your class.

apps.name: Funbrain
apps.description: Link to interactive online learning activities targeted at K-8 learners.

apps.name: BrainPOP
apps.description: Lessons and activities centered around an educational topic. Link to any BrainPop lessons, or to specific resources within a lesson.

apps.name: Manga High
apps.description: Free game-based math learning resources for K-12 learners. Games and activities can be linked to from within any course content. Visit Manga High's web site for instructions on how to sign up as a school.

apps.name: Programr
apps.description: Programr offers coding challenge projects for programming languages including Java, C# and C++. Link to any of the available challenges from your course material.
apps.short_description: Coding challenges in Java, C# and C++

apps.name: Spelling City
apps.description: Spelling City offers a collection of spelling practice resources, including games, drills, and handwriting practice around different sets of words. Link to any of these resources from within your course.

apps.name: Elementary Paper
apps.description: Elementary Paper offers printable handwriting practice sheets. Link to any of the freely available sheets.

apps.name: Filament Games
apps.description: Link to a collection of online games focusing on different learning activities.

apps.name: SoftChalk Cloud Open
apps.description: SoftChalk Cloud hosts a collection of open-licensed learning resources created by users. This is a collection of some of those resources. Preview or link to any of these resources.
apps.short_description: Reusable content built using SoftChalk Cloud

apps.name: YouTube For Schools
apps.description:
YouTube for Schools is a collection of edu-centric videos that can be whitelisted for campus access without opening up all of YouTube. A new icon in your course editor lets you browse YouTube's EDU content and click to embed videos in your course.

Learn more about setting up YouTube for Schools.

apps.name: Open Tapestry
apps.description:
Open Tapestry helps instructors discover, modify, and share open educational resources from across the web. Resources and lessons can be inserted directly into course content, while maintaining their functionality.

Register on OpenTapestry and click "Configure Integrations" to retrieve your consumer key and shared secret.

apps.name: USA Today
apps.description: Search for and link to articles from USA Today's archives.

apps.name: Speeqe Chat
apps.description:
Speeqe chat allows you to add chat rooms to web pages. This app lets you add a chat room as a course navigation link for your students.

NOTE that since Speeqe doesn't run over SSL, you'll get security warnings when using in a Canvas instance that runs on https

apps.name: Wolfram Alpha
apps.description:
DISABLED DUE TO TERMS OF USE VIOLATION. WOLFRAM HAS SENT US A WORKAROUND, YET TO BE IMPLEMENTED.
Wolfram Alpha provides graphs, data sets and other information about numbers, equations, etc. This app lets you quickly insert links to Wolfram Alpha search results into your course material.
apps.short_description: Link to Wolfram Alpha search results

apps.name: Blackboard Collaborate
apps.description:
Create and record web conferencing sessions within your course. Can be used for virtual classrooms time, office hours, group work, etc. Also supports podcasting, presentations and voice boards.

Contact Blackboard for account registration and to retrieve a key and secret.

apps.name: Redirect Tool
apps.description:
Add links to external web resources that show up as navigation items in course, user or account navigation. Whatever URL you specify is loaded within the content pane when users click the link.

To configure this app you specify the text and URL you'd like to add to navigation elements in the LMS, then check the areas you'd like it added to. User navigation will only appear if this app is installed at the root level.

NOTE: If your LMS is loading over https instead of http, then links won't load correctly in all browsers if the link is to an http URL. Also, some sites refuse to be loaded in an iframe and will "take over" the full page when launched, removing the LMS navigation around the material.

apps.name: YouTube Channel
apps.description:
Search publicly available YouTube videos within a specific channel. A new icon will show up in your course rich editor letting you search YouTube and click to embed videos in your course material.

YouTube channel names are found in the URL of the channel (i.e. the channel name for http://www.youtube.com/user/DiscoveryEducation would be DiscoveryEducation).

apps.name: Chalk and Wire
apps.description:
Chalk & Wire provides ePortfolio, Assessment and Data Analysis Tools that can be used to help improve the student learning experience.

Contact Chalk & Wire for information on signing up for an account and getting a key and secret.

apps.name: ALEKS
apps.description:
ALEKS is an artificial intelligent assessment and learning system which uses adaptive questioning to quickly and accurately determine exactly what a student knows and doesn't know in a course.

Visit the ALEKS Training Center for directions on configuring your ALEKS Higher Education school account. Look for the 'LTI Integration' section.

apps.name: SCORM Cloud
apps.description:
Delivers SCORM packages in a standardized way across learning platforms. Robust SCORM engine with built-in grade passback and activity tracking.

Sign up for a SCORM Cloud account and upload your SCORM packages to get started. A consumer key and secret are automatically generated for each package, and can be retrieved from the package settings page.

apps.name: WebPA
apps.description:
WebPA is an open source online peer assessment tool that can be used for course activities. It also allows sharing assessment activities across courses or even institutions.

Directions for configuring WebPA:
  1. Set up your WebPA instance
  2. Download the WebPA LTI connector
  3. Follow these configuration instructions


You can also sign up for a free trial account here.

apps.name: VoiceThread
apps.description:
VoiceThread is a collaborative communication tool that allows text, audio, video, voice and annotated communication. Once VoiceThread is accessed within your LMS, your users will be signed into their accounts.

VoiceThread will also create a Group under your VoiceThread license that houses content for the course within your LMS.

Register at VoiceThread.com and contact the company to request a consumer key and shared secret.

apps.name: Vanilla Forums
apps.description:
Vanilla is an open source community forum tool that can be run for your institution, department or course. This app allows for auto-login to the Vanilla forum from course content or course navigation.

Directions for configuring Vanilla:
  1. Set up your Vanilla forum
  2. Download the Vanilla LTI plugin
  3. Extract the LTI plugin into Vanilla's plugins folder
  4. Enter the Vanilla plugin section to enable it
  5. Edit IMSBasicLTI/configuration/authorizedConsumersKey.cfg and add

    consumer_key.external.enabled=1
    consumer_key.external.secret=super_sekret_code

    where external is replaced with whatever you want to be the consumer key
  6. For more detailed configuration, follow the directions here

apps.name: New York Times
apps.description: Search for and link to articles from New York Times archives. Articles can be filtered by relevance and year published.

apps.name: Drupal
apps.description:
Drupal is an open source content management system. It's flexible enough to be used for community sites, Q&A services, forums, standard web pages, etc. This LTI app allows auto-login to Drupal sites from another system.

Directions for configuring Drupal:
  1. Follow the directions on the Drupal LTI Tool Provider page to install and configure.
  2. Be sure to make a note of the consumer key and shared secret.
  3. More information is available here

apps.name: QuestionMark
apps.description:
QuestionMark is a tool for creating and delivering surveys, quizzes and exams. Instructors can add assessments to their course content on configured accounts.

Directions for configuring QuestionMark:
  1. Configure your QuestionMark instance
  2. Download and install the QuestionMark LTI extension
  3. Follow the provided configuration direction
  4. For more detailed configuration, follow the directions here

apps.name: PLATO
apps.description:
PLATO provides standards-based online curriculum in a rich, interactive environment. Embed learning resources from PLATO within your course.

Visit the PLATO web site for more information and to retrieve a key and secret.

apps.name: McGraw Hill Campus
apps.description:
Provides access to McGraw Hill's interactive resources tied to course content and textbooks. This app auto-logs users into MH-Campus from within course material.

Configuration information is provided directly by McGraw Hill. Visit mhcampus.com for more information.

apps.name: Pinterest
apps.description:
DISABLED DUE TO DEPRECATED API
Search for images shared on Pinterest. Clicking an image will embed it in your course material with a link back to the original page the image is pulled from.
apps.test_instructions: API is gone :-(

apps.name: Gooru Learning
apps.description:
DISABLED DUE TO UNFINISHED-NESS.
Search collections of open and public learning resources from across the Internet. Insert links to learning resource collections created by other instructors.

apps.name: Pathbrite
apps.description: Pathbrite is an ePortfolio tool that can be integrated into the LMS.

apps.name: PebblePad
apps.description: PebblePad is an ePortfolio tool that can be integrated into the LMS.

apps.name: Mediasite
apps.description:
Mediasite is a webcasting and lecture capture solution that can be integrated into the LMS.

Configuration details should be provided by your Mediasite account representative.

apps.name: YouTube Uploader
apps.description: Record videos from your webcam or upload them from your desktop into your personal YouTube account. Newly-created videos are automatically linked within your course content.

apps.name: Prulu
apps.description:
Prulu is a classroom Q&A-style site with inline equations, basic analytics and notifications. This integration adds a link to the course navigation for Prulu discussions.

Contact Prulu for instructions on getting a consumer key and secret.

apps.name: Via Response
apps.description: Via Response is a cloud student response system that lets students use their own devices for classroom response. Via also handles hybrid and lecture-capture classes where students participate remotely or asynchronously, case studies, image questions, equation editors, chat and more. Via is always free for instructors.

apps.name: Learning Catalytics
apps.description:
Learning Catalytics is a cloud-based solution for engaging students with authentic formative assessments in real time both inside and outside of the classroom, and rich data analytics that are used to drive student interactions.

Setting up Learning Catalytics is different depending on your account and contract, so please be sure to follow these instructions for setting up Learning Catalytics in your LMS.

apps.name: Knowillage LeaP
apps.description:
Using your existing learning outcomes and course content, Knowillage LeaP™ quickly creates personalized adaptive learning paths, offers recommendations, provides remediation and much more, all in a way that’s intuitive and very easy-to-use by teachers and students alike.

You'll need to Register for a Knowillage account in order to receive a key and secret for this app.

apps.name: Smarthinking
apps.description:
On-demand student mentoring and tutoring that can be embedded as a course or user resource.

Contact your account representative for details on getting a consumer key, secret and Launch URL.

apps.name: Google Charts
apps.description: Build and embed interactive charts, rendered using Google Charts. Populate the fields provided and see the chart update in real-time while building. Supports pie charts, bar charts, bubble charts, tree maps, etc.

apps.name: EchoCenter
apps.description: The EchoCenter is a content portal used by Echo360 faculty and students to access their rich media recordings and for faculty to view usage statistics for the captured lectures.
apps.test_instructions:
Logon to https://echo360.instructure.com.
Username:  wbarnes@echo360.com
Password:  marrelli

Once logged in, navigate to the Introduction to Echo360 course.
Click the EchoCenter course navigation link.
Select the Introduction to Echo360 - Section 001 from the drop down.

If you would like to create and configure the external tool:
1) Go to the Introduction to Echo360 course
2) Select settings
3) Select External Tools
4) Click add external tool
5) Provide a name for the tool
6) Key:  canvas
7) Secret: Dq0JzwfquR9B4vG+aerLrYmxxaJ7lNvZmAR99Q5fBud7Y/xtIxcW8+v8dpAloYh7dT+vqWLsDQKGG8Ekj+bddQ== 
8) Configuration Type:  By URL - https://integration.qa.echo360.com:8443/ess/lti/v1/configuration/ba18f448-8352-4016-a42d-3b39d6c5755f

This will create a duplicate EchoCenter navigation link in the course navigation area and is only assigned to one EchoSystem course so there is no drop down in this case.

apps.name: GitHub
apps.description: Embeds project summaries or code gists from GitHub's social coding site. Includes major language, commit dates, forks and watchers for repos, syntax-highlighted code for gists.

apps.name: i>clicker
apps.description:
i>clicker is an audience response system used for tracking student answers on pop quizzes, surveys, etc. This app lets you run and track your i>clicker assessments from within the learning platform.

Please note that the use of i>clicker Integrate requires the involvement of campus IT staff. If you are interested in taking advantage of i>clicker Integrate for Instructure Canvas or any other supported LMS, please contact your i>clicker Technology Specialist or write to us at contact@iclicker.com and we will begin the process.

apps.name: Cranium Cafe
apps.description:
Cranium Cafe enables academic advising, proctoring services, financial aid counseling, tutoring, communication between teacher and student and between students via live online meetings seamlessly integrated into LTI enabled platforms.

Cranium Cafe’s software has the capacity to enhance internal LMS communication within courses, tutoring sessions and academic advising discussions. This interpersonal relationship building platform is also designed for use outside of an LMS. Outside communication would be for new students looking to connect with a school’s recruiters, for academic advising and for financial aid assistance.

Cranium Cafe Profile Settings & Scheduler Setup Video: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=25hVMCWOkgI

Cranium Cafe: How to Join Meetings & Meeting Tools Video: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=gh9c6aHfbto
apps.short_description: Video chat and whiteboard tools for one on one communication.
apps.test_instructions:
This short video demonstrates a Cranium Cafe session:  
http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=gh9c6aHfbto

Using the XML configuration URL from any canvas install should work.

key: lti-examples
secret: 061cc83a038c125c8147cdbfc53d1bda2ef32e7a

apps.name: Feed The Me
apps.description:
Feed The Me lets teachers aggregate a number of news feeds (Atom or RSS), filtered by tags, within the course environment. For example, this might be relevant blogs or news feeds from external sources, or perhaps a collection of student-produced blogs.

Teachers can allow Students to add their own news feeds to the course feeds list, and can even submit a feed to fulfill an assignment requirement.

The resulting feed list includes post titles (hyperlinked to the original blog), author, date posted, and a post summary.

In order to use this tool, you must generate a key and shared secret after authenticating via Twitter through the FeedTheMe LTI web page.

apps.name: Text Reader
apps.description:
Lightweight app that lets teachers create blocks of text where students can click any word in the text and retrieve an inline definition of the word.

If you're interested in using this heavily you should reach out to the owners of IMathAS beforehand since heavy unexpected load may cause problems.

apps.name: BookShelf
apps.description:
Access your books anytime anywhere. VitalSource Bookshelf® lets you access your eTextbooks online or download for offline viewing.

Highlight passages and add your notes. Even better, subscribe to your friends and teachers, and "follow" them as they make their own notes and highlights. You can even search through their notes. Search one book or all your books. Right-click any word to find definitions immediately.

Click the Support link located on this page to contact VitalSource for configuration assistance.
apps.test_instructions: http://bookshelf.vitalsource.com/

apps.name: Learning.com
apps.description: Embed resources available from learning.com into your course material.

apps.name: BadgeStack
apps.description:
This app allows course members to automatically log into your BadgeStack-enabled Wordpress site from your LMS. Tbe BadgeStack add-on for the BadgeOS Wordpress plugin automatically creates all the achievement types and pages needed to quickly set up your very own badging system.

This tool requires that you are running your own WordPress instance with the BadgeOS plugin. Both are free and open source.

apps.name: Taskstream
apps.description:
Taskstream is an ePortfolio and assessment engine that can be embedded within the learning platform.

Contact your account representative for details on getting configuration options.

apps.name: Harvard Business Publishing
apps.description: Launch simulations from Harvard Business publishing content within your course or content. Configuration instructions will be provided by your Harvard Business account representative.

apps.name: Toolwire
apps.description:
Launch Toolwire learning resources from within your course material.

Configuration instructions should be provided by your Toolwire account representative.

apps.name: uCertify
apps.description:
Embed test preparation resources for IT certifications.

Configuration instructions should be provided by your account representative.

apps.name: MediaCore
apps.description:
Media management focused on educational content, lets you quickly link to and embed media resources within content.

Configuration details should be provided by your MediaCore account representative.

apps.name: Odyssey
apps.description: Embed state and common core-aligned personalized learning experiences.

apps.name: WebAssign
apps.description:
Embed auto-graded math and science homework within your course material.

Your WebAssign account representative should provide you with configuration instructions.

apps.name: SoftChalk Cloud
apps.description: Build, modify and link to learning resources created using the SoftChalk Cloud development engine. Supports writing grades back when used as a graded assessment.

apps.name: Learn LTI
apps.description:
Provides a series of lessons to help people learn and implement their own LTI-compliant integration. Short lessons with an interactive testing engine help the learner to gradually build up expertise about the different pieces of LTI functionality.

You can find instructions for getting a key and secret on the site home page.

apps.name: Trello
apps.description: Trello lets you organize thoughts and ideas into categories or lists. It works well as a (potentially collaborative) to-do list or task manager. This app shows summary information for a public Trello board.

apps.name: EvaluationKIT
apps.description:
EvaluationKIT is a fully-hosted course evaluation and survey system designed to streamline course evaluation setup and drive student participation in surveys. EvaluationKIT provides all the functionality needed to manage the student feedback process including survey authoring tools, automated reporting for instructors and administrators (specific to just their courses or areas they oversee), and much more.

More info at www.evaluationkit.com.

apps.name: Pixton Comic Maker
apps.description:
Unleash student creativity! Pixton is an award-winning tool that gives students a fun, new way to express themselves in the graphical, narrative format of comics.

Design and control fully posable, expressive characters, speech bubbles, backgrounds, photos, and even voice-over. Print, download, and embed comics.

Perfect for summarizing a reading, applying vocabulary, re-enacting events, creating a narrative or graphic novel, demonstrating comprehension, explaining a concept, and developing critical thinking skills.

To obtain your key and secret, go to http://canvas.pixton.com/start where you can sign up for a 30-day free trial.
apps.short_description: Award-winning tool that gives students a fun, new way to express themselves in the graphical narrative format of comics.
apps.test_instructions:

    Consumer Key: kgreym
    Shared Secret: edfr06t1
    Configuration Type: By URL
    Configuration URL: https://www.pixton.com/platform/canvas/schools/lti-config

OR, go to http://canvas.pixton.com/start and register for a free trial to obtain a new key and secret.

apps.name: Open Badges
apps.description: The Open Badges app displays a user's public badges from Mozilla Backpack (openbadges.org) within the LMS. This app is a perfect way to allow your students to view the badges they have earned.
apps.short_description: Display Open Badges from the openbadges.org backpack
apps.test_instructions: Submit LTI request including user email to: http://dataii.com/badges/LTI/index.php

apps.name: StudyMate Class
apps.description:
StudyMate Class helps students "master the basics" of course material through learning activities, self-assessments, and games. A dozen activities – such as flash cards, crosswords and quizzes – engage students with course content in an individualized way. StudyMate Class resides within a Canvas course and allows both instructors and students to create items collaboratively. Student contributions and participation can be monitored and graded.

For more information check out the Canvas Instructor Guide.
apps.short_description: StudyMate Class helps students "master the basics" of course material through learning activities, self-assessments, and games.

apps.name: SWoRD Peer Review
apps.description:
SWoRD is a cloud-based, collaborative learning tool that improves writing skills for secondary school and college students. SWoRD’s unique grading algorithms eliminate peer bias, ensuring that students take their reviewing task seriously and optimizing learning outcomes. This integration adds course and assignment-level embedding options for SWoRD content.

Rubric- creation tools and document double-blind anonymity provide the core peer review platform, with SWoRD additionally offering processes and mathematical models to reward students who provide the most objective and helpful feedback. Analytical tools allow students to graphically view how their comments and grading compares with others. SWoRD’s collaborative scalable assessment allows writing across the curriculum in classrooms and online environments of any size.

Contact Panther Learning to retrieve a consumer key and secret.
apps.test_instructions:
key: test
password:  test
Please feel free contact ivetic@pantherlearning.com with any questions or configuration issues.

apps.name: Dropbox
apps.description:
This lightweight integration lets Dropbox users select and link to files within course content or in conjunction with homework submissions.

Dropbox is a file hosting service offering cloud storage, file synchronization, and client software. Files placed in a Dropbox folder also are accessible through a website and mobile phone applications.

The current integration does require that users login to Dropbox each time.

apps.name: Study.Net
apps.description:
App used to access digital course content assembled in a Study.Net course. Study.Net is a web service used to assemble, manage and deliver personal and copyright digital course content, and to facilitate the use of digital course material by students.

For information on signing up for an account and obtaining a key and secret, please contact Study.Net.
apps.short_description: App used to access and display Study.Net course material in Canvas environment

A course_nav menu item [Study.Net Course Materials] should appear in the left navbar in Canvas, which when clicked should display the Study.Net interface in the content area with Study.Net course materials and/or course purchase link.

apps.name: Blue Portal Integrator
apps.description: Blue™ fully automates course and instructor evaluations, psychometric and knowledge tests development, 360 reviews and organization-wide surveys. Blue’s key differentiator is that it can fully adjust to your organization needs, whether by tailoring your survey and report formats to easily integrate into your existing software infrastructure, or by offering access support to Blue from a variety of computing platforms. Blue enables organizations to perfect their services by soliciting and analyzing feedback, issuing reports, and then monitoring the improvement in services.
apps.short_description: eXplorance’s Blue™ fully automates course and instructor evaluations, psychometric and knowledge tests development, 360 reviews and organization-wide surveys.

apps.name: Soft Chalk Cloud
apps.description:
SoftChalk Cloud’s platform combines learning object repository, content authoring, content sharing/management and student score tracking functionality. It integrates with LMSs via LTI, or can be used without an LMS.

Through LTI and SoftChalk’s ScoreCenter, instructors can paste the LTI hyperlink for content into one or multiple courses in one or more LMSs. When the instructor updates the content in SoftChalk Cloud, every course is updated simultaneously. Student scores are tracked by ScoreCenter and results are passed into the LMS gradebook. Instructors can view, edit and set score properties within the gradebook, which is linked, via LTI, to the ScoreCenter.
apps.short_description: SoftChalk Cloud’s platform combines learning object repository, content authoring, content sharing/management and student score tracking functionality. It integrates with LMSs via LTI, or can be used without an LMS.
apps.test_instructions: See the "Learning Management System Guides" in the SoftChalk Resources Guide at http://support.softchalk.com/FileManagement/Download/726dccc27b43497b85da764450d2a7c9

apps.name: The Learning Registry
apps.description: Search list of content collected as part of the Learning Registry, an online initiative to share and reuse learning resources from across the Internet.

apps.name: Vimeo
apps.description:
Vimeo is a video sharing website on which users can upload, share, and view videos. The community of Vimeo includes indie, professional, and novice filmmakers. The Vimeo LTI tool lets users search for and embed videos into course content.

Developer's note:This app was built to be an example of an elegant, well-coded resource picker apps (source code available)
apps.test_instructions: Search for a video and then embed it into your content.

apps.name: ExamSoft
apps.description: ExamSoft offers clients a secure computer-based testing and assessment analytics suite that provides actionable outcomes data and insights. Our platforms support the entire assessment process, including question banking; exam blueprinting; take-home assignment management and analysis; and flexible reporting features, presented visually, for easily digestible teaching and learning data analysis. With our secure exam delivery backed by military-grade encryption, educators can deliver exams to any laptop or iPad without WiFi dependency. This is a single-sign-on integration.
apps.short_description: ExamSoft secure computer-based testing and assessment analytics platform

apps.name: ExamSoft
apps.description: ExamSoft offers clients a secure computer-based testing and assessment analytics suite that provides actionable outcomes data and insights. Our platforms support the entire assessment process, including question banking; exam blueprinting; take-home assignment management and analysis; and flexible reporting features, presented visually, for easily digestible teaching and learning data analysis. With our secure exam delivery backed by military-grade encryption, educators can deliver exams to any laptop or iPad without WiFi dependency. This is a single-sign-on integration.
apps.short_description: ExamSoft secure computer based testing and assessment analytics.

apps.name: Starfish
apps.description: Starfish is enterprise student success software which tightly integrates with LMSes and SISes.  Starfish EARLY ALERT™ identifies at-risk students based on the reported observations of advisors, instructors, and other student services staff members as well as based on data within your LMS and SIS such as grades, assignments, activity, holds, and registrations.  Starfish CONNECT™ offers online appointment scheduling, waiting room management, and the ability for student services staff (e.g., advisors, counselors, tutors) to document their interactions with students.  Academic plans, success plans and case management features ensure the student and the campus know the next step for success.
apps.short_description: early alert, student plans, appointment scheduling, and case management

apps.name: BigBlueButton
apps.description: BigBlueButton is an open source web conferencing system for on-line learning.  The LTI integration enables teachers to (a) embed BigBlueButton virtual classes within their course to provide on-line office hours, small group collaboration, and on-line lectures, (b) record sessions, and (c) manage recorded sessions.

apps.name: LTI Maps
apps.description:
Google Maps is a web based mapping service offered by Google Inc. It allows you to find addresses, businesses, and points of interests. My LTI Tool allows anyone to embed a Google Map into the course via the Rich Text Editor.

Source code available here.
apps.test_instructions:
"Add a new external tool inside of your course or account, set the ""Configuration Type"" to ""By URL"".
Name: LTI Maps
Key: 'abc' (Any key will do)
Secret: '123' (Any secret will do)
Configuration URL: http://ltimaps.aws.af.cm/config.xml
Save the new tool.

Bring up a rich text editor and locate the Google Map Pin marker in the tool bar and click it.

Enter in Street Address, City and Sate. and click ""Create my Map""

You'll be presented with a preview of the Map, if all looks good click ""Embed it!"" and you'll be taken back to Canvas.

From here you can drag the iframe box around if you wish to resize the map.
Click ""Save"" and check out your map!

When looking at an embedded map in Canvas you have full access to the usual controls such as move/zoom and Map/Satellite/Terrain/Earth.

Try switching the map to ""Earth"" and enjoy Google Earth inside of Canvas!
"

apps.name: QuestionPress
apps.description: QuestionPress offers live web-based classroom response, assessments, surveys, and polling to any web device. The LTI/LMS integration allows you to embed QuestionPress directly into your LMS page (ie. an assignment page), expedites responder enrollment into a QuestionPress session, and passes scores from QuestionPress back up to the LMS grade book.

Password ltitester

apps.name: CloudTime
apps.description:
CloudTime lets you easily set up and distribute Amazon EC2 virtual machines. It is a simple and very customized view of an associated Amazon AWS account, designed for teachers that want to offer cloud infrastructure to their students (i.e. computer programming, engineering and other subjects that need computing).

The LTI CloudTime integration lets teachers to create, start, shutdown an see the virtual machines and assign them to the students over the course. It also lets students to start and shutdown their assigned machines and know how to access to them.

To set up CloudTime you'll need to follow the directions provided in the documentation. Make sure to write down the domain for launch (https://something.com) and also the name of the AWS region (something like ec2.ap-southeast-2.amazonaws.com) where your instances are located, since you'll need these for the LTI configuration.

Source code available.
apps.test_instructions:
"Launch URL: http://84.89.0.98/lti-CloudTime/index.php
Key: test
Secret: secret123
Custom parameters: aws_region=ec2.ap-southeast-2.amazonaws.com
"

apps.name: XWiki
apps.description:
XWiki (http://www.xwiki.org) is a wiki that has powerful extensibility features such as scripting in pages and plugins. It is also a powerful development platform that allows you to customize the wiki to your specific needs. Wikis enable students and teachers to create content online using easily understandable and collaborative tools. As such its use cases in education are diverse: collaborative work, knowledge base, CMS, public debate, collaborative creation of courses, web site creation, etc.

The LTI XWiki integration sets up a specific wiki space for each course, and lets teachers to administrate this space (i.e. Wiki skins, language, plug-ins and others) and students to edit and create pages collaboratively.

To set up XWiki and retrieve the necessary configuration details, follow the online documentation. Source code available here.
apps.test_instructions:
"End Point: http://23.20.4.123:8080/webapps/xwiki/wiki/testimslti/

Consumer key: uoc.test

Shared secret:  secret1234"
apps.author_name: Jordi Duran Cals - Open University of Catalonia

apps.name: ApprenNet
apps.description:
Integrate hands-on learning exercises into your course. With ApprenNet's LTI APP, you can add exercises to your course in which participants 1) submit video responses, 2) review their peers, 3) receive feedback and 4) engage with experts. Make e-learning interactive and social.

Request a trial to receive an LTI key and secret.
apps.test_instructions:
"To test ApprenNet LTI integration, first follow the “Configuration Instructions” listed below and use the following information to add ApprenNet as an External Tool:

Key: AGneyUtX1qoAeTyVVCm7
Secret: Lx1Wo2JCjgjr1MCikRcK
Configuration URL: http://apprennet.com/lti-config.xml
Launch URL (this should be included in the Configuration URL): https://www.apprennet.com/lti-launch

Once ApprenNet is added to your Canvas course as an external tool, you can include an External Tool link to ApprenNet in a Canvas module.

When an instructor user launches ApprenNet as an external tool, it will prompt him or her to create an account. Once the ApprenNet account is created, the LTI link will automatically create an ApprenNet group for the course and add the instructor as a group owner. Subsequent LTI launches by students in the course will automatically enroll students into the course’s ApprenNet group. 

As a group owner, the instructor can add Meets to the group by selecting the “This Meet is closed and accessible only by assigned Groups” option when creating a new Meet within ApprenNet.
"

apps.name: Concourse
apps.description: Concourse is a syllabus management platform. Centrally support master templates, accreditation reporting, workflow, auditing and archival all without leaving the LMS course. Also includes keyword search and previews, public and mobile access, automated notifications, and insertion of boilerplate policies for syllabi across the entire institution.

URL: https://demo.campusconcourse.com/
Key: auto
Secret: auto

Concourse is also often added to course and/or account navigation using corresponding XML.

Additionally, you can log on directly to https://demo.campusconcourse.com and visit https://demo.campusconcourse.com/admin_system to adjust LTI launch parameters. Please note that in the demo your selections reset nightly.

More information about LTI can be found in our Knowledge Base:

http://support.campusconcourse.com/entries/21608673-How-do-I-integrate-with-my-LMS-"

apps.name: Tandem
apps.description:
Tandem is a small content management system that allows students to practice their speaking skills by doing synchronous pair tasks (e.g. Spot-the-difference-like activities). Its aim is to facilitate the practice of language in pairs, giving a purpose to the conversation and an extra motivation for students.

The LTI Tandem integration lets students choose a partner in their course and starts practicing language (in combination with some audio or videoconferencing tool). It also allows teachers to upload new Tandem activities previously downloaded or created from the SpeakApps OER repository.

Source code available.
apps.test_instructions:

Key: test
Secret: secret123

Notes:
- We should configure de LTI consumer to open the tool in a new window.
- In standard LTI consumer implementations (without our extensions), the student list to select the partner will only include the students who have previously accessed to the tool.
"

apps.name: Ayamel
apps.description:
Ayamel is a web-based system for streaming video and audio content, including captions and subtitles, especially as it applies to learning a foreign language. The LTI App connects these media aggregations and pedagogical supports on Ayamel to any LTI-conformant LMS. Learners using the LMS are then able to access and view immediately the videos they need, at the exact location, with the necessary learning content to suit specific instructional objectives.

Source code available.
apps.test_instructions:
"Because each course has its own LTI credentials, an example course was created for testing.
Create the External Tool using the following information:

Launch URL:      http://ayamel.byu.edu/course/15/ltiAuth
Consumer Key:    15
Consumer Secret: e27eb40d16bafff8121b5d7f628d0398

To see the features that Ayamel offers, feel free to view the ""Dreyfus"" or ""Doctor-1"" videos. Both of these include caption tracks you can turn on. Highlight any words in the captions or in the transcription to get an automatic translation. Click on colored/underlined words (looks like a link) in the captions or transcription to view an annotation associated with that word.

For help with the Ayamel site, please refer to the help pages at http://ayamel.byu.edu/help"

apps.name: StudyRoom
apps.description:
StudyRoom is a social learning platform that makes courses a more collaborative and social experience. Students can finally meet their classmates online, form study groups and really study together. All from their computer's browser, iPad or iPhone. Our LTI app lets teachers embed a study room in their course.

After creating a course on www.getstudyroom.com and creating an account, you can simply go to the admin panel as shown in the walkthrough video (or direct link to admin panel: http://www.getstudyroom.com/editor/) where, under the "Settings" tab, you can find all you need to set it up with the Learning Platform you prefer.

apps.name: Aspire Analytics
apps.description: Aspire Analytics is a solution that helps schools increase student retention. The solution identifies students that are most at risk of dropping out of or failing online courses and ranks the riskiest students – across ALL courses they may be taking. Aspire provides an easy-to-read dashboard that is available within your school’s instance of Canvas. Contact AspirEDU for account registration.

Since the data must be gotten from the LMS (currently Canvas) through the LMS API, this data has already been gathered for the demo purposes. Note that this is a sample that represents real data: personal information has been removed, but the scores are not contrived.  If things don't work correctly, feel free to get in touch with me at ryan@ryanhiebert.com, or 707.200.1024, and I'll help get the kinks worked out.

It's a new service / LTI app that lets you enter code snippets using a built-in code editor and embed them using standard LTI.

The functionality is really basic right now (only supports standard LTI stuff), but I think it could be used in a lot of really cool ways.

They then can use the tool to embed code using the standard LTI process."

apps.name: Atomic Learning LTI
apps.description: With the Atomic Learning LTI Tool, instructors can search Atomic Learning’s online library of technology training videos and learning resources from within their LMS—and easily embed links to resources within courses. Faculty, staff, and students will have direct access to the technology training and support content they need in their existing learning system.
apps.short_description: Seamlessly integrate Atomic Learning’s online technology training video tutorials and resources into online courses without requiring staff or students to leave the LMS.
apps.test_instructions:
Test Key: 9d0b6deb154ad00e9614
Test Secret:0f71f7582c029dedc638
Configure LTI tool using configuration XML at the account level.  
https://static.atomiclearning.com/lti/config.xml

To use the configured LTI tool:
The Atomic Learning LTI tool allows you to seamlessly integrate Atomic Learning into your course within Canvas.  It allows you to include any Atomic Learning training and content and integrate it into your course without requiring you or your students to leave Canvas.
Adding Atomic Learning content is a two-step process: The first step is to add the training as a resource for the course, and the second step is to actually choose the training that will appear.  Let’s use the LTI tool to add Atomic Learning as a resource first.
To access the LTI tool, first go into your course and create or open an assignment.  Then, on the right, click Edit Assignment.  Under the Type drop-down menu, choose External Tool, and then click Atomic Learning to add the URL automatically.  Although it’s not required, we recommend checking the checkbox to load the tool in a new tab.  This will give you more room within the LTI tool to view the training page and individual tutorials.  
Then Click Select.
User must be an instructor within the course.
Enter the rest of the information as you would with any assignment.  Then click Save or Update Assignment, depending on whether you’re working in a new or existing assignment.  Great, that’s the first step.
Now that we’ve added the resource, it’s time for step two: choosing the content.  In the Assignments list, click the resource you just created.  If you checked the box to open it in a new tab, and depending on your browser, you may need to click a button to launch the tool in a new window or tab.  This search box is very similar to the search box on AtomicLearning.com, but you don’t have to leave Canvas to search – pretty cool, right?  If you have custom content, you’ll see a Custom Training tab next to the Search tab, and any custom training created there will appear under that tab.  Search for the desired training by keyword or series name.   You can filter the search results and navigate through pages just like you would on the Atomic Learning site.
Once you find the series you want, click on it to move into the tutorial selection page.  Notice there are checkboxes next to each tutorial title – check a box to select an individual tutorial.  You can also click on sections to select whole sections, or the Check All link to select every tutorial in the series.  When you’ve selected the tutorials you want, click Preview Selections to move to the preview page.  This page shows you what it’ll look like within your course once you save it, and you can even click individual links to preview individual tutorials; note that nothing is created yet. 
If you want to make changes, click the Back button, or if this looks good, click the Submit button.  If you opened this link in a new page or tab, you’ll see a message telling you that you can now close it.
Once the resource is created, if you realize at this point that you wanted to include or exclude tutorials from the resource, simply delete the one you created and create a new resource for the course.
I’ll click the Assignment to open it up, click that button to open a new page or tab if it appears, and then click one of the tutorial links.  As you can see, right here within Canvas, a player window opens and the tutorial begins to play.  Awesome.

apps.name: NBC Learn
apps.description: NBC Learn is the educational arm of NBC News dedicated to providing resources for students, teachers, and lifelong learners. The online resources NBC Learn has created for the education community leverages nearly 80 years of historic news coverage, documentary materials, and current news broadcasts. NBC Learn gives students and teachers access to thousands of video clips from the NBC News archives, including great historic moments--from the Great Depression to the Space Race to the latest political coverage. NBC Learn also features more than 15,000 historic news reports, primary source documents, current events, and original series including the Emmy Award-winning “Science of NFL Football”, “Science of NHL Hockey” and “Science of the Summer Olympics”.  And we recently launched “Campus Perspectives”, which features compelling stories from campuses nationwide and aims to inspire students with the possibilities of taking their education to the next level.

app_review.comments: working again, thanks @whitmer

The Wikipedia LTI integration when added into the Editor adds value by giving the user options.  They can choose to preview an article or link to an article as with most integrations.  The Embed is a nice addition though, users can choose to embed the Wikipedia article directly within Canvas.

Works great, 24 search results are retrieved in keyword searches and both a link and EMBED option are available.  I love it when the LTI content is easily embeddable.  Adds value.

- Melanie
This site will be closing down at the end of 2012 so no longer relevant soon.

The Khan Academy site has many useful resources on many subjects.  A wonderful resource, the downside is unfortunately only browsing by subject is available, not keyword searching in this LTI.  So if content is not easily   found, it is worth sending faculty directly to the site as well.
Works great.

Wonderful addition and website.  I didn't test the depth of content on the educreations website but the samples I found were worthwhile and the LTI integration embeds the lesson in the page.  Educreations itself has a useful tool for faculty to create their own lessons as well outside the LTI integration.  A useful addition.
May have limited use but this LTI works well and adds value.  The Twitter feed from a keyword, hashtag, or specific user is embedded within the page.

Though it's nice you can search just the education site and the LTI helps embed the video within the page, there is a browse only feature and not a keyword search within the LTI.  It may be better in some cases to direct users to the site:  http://youtube.com/education to keyword search if what they find is not easily available.

Though I love the idea of searching and easily embedding video within a page, I wish the search results were longer.  16 results are returned for each search so use your keywords wisely or go direct to Youtube if you have difficulty through the LTI in finding a video.

As a tech geek I must admit this has limited use but it is fun to be able to quickly embed the dynamic summary information about a Git Hub project into a page!  Works great.  A more open search would even make it better.

I didn't try the grading features but the setup for this is very simple and seems to be a wonderful tool!  (I'm not a math instructor so will not verify the content, just the ease of use of the integration...)

The integration works seamlessly and searches and retrieves a variety of content but my disappointment is often the internet archive website does not have clear descriptions and titles so it can be difficult to find the content you are looking for.
Who doesn't love a kitten?

Phenomenal tool.  Allows for quick and easy video recording, publishing, embedding within a page.  Was fast with great quality and very few clicks.  Only downside is the default is Public view instead of Unlisted.
Excellent LTI for using OER in an LMS

While the lack of subject browsing is a downside - the upside is that the material is presented in an easy to understand manner. This allows students to consume the data online, before and after the classroom experience (online or F2F) which promotes better understanding.
This is a phenomenally flexible option. Love it!
Couldn't get it to work at all. Would just come up with a blank screen on Moodle 2.4.3.
Lack of direct access to courses and exercises makes this is a disappoint addition.
Works well with Moodle 2.4.3. Easy to embed and use.
Search should be working correctly now!
Searches are working correctly for me now.
I would love to see an option that would allow the URL Redirect to be launched in its own Window and not in the Canvas frame.
Talk about a great tool for Canvas! @instructure
Looks very nice and easy to use for pulling in RSS feeds to a course.  I still can't figure out how the "enable homework submissions" works though.
Worked great on Canvas. Maybe it's a Moodle issue?

Shows a given Trello board in a customized view which is kinda' nice, but it's not possible to click into each list to see your tasks. I prefer the standard Trello web view. Still nifty and maybe a step towards what's to come?

Hi, I am still having trouble with this. Simply supplying the Link Name, URL Redirect is not loading the resource after it has been added to a course/ user/ account nav. There's something to do with the http vs https. Any info on this would be greatly appreciated.
I was thinking of creating the same thing! Love it!

Worked well, but need more instructions.  I loaded it as the root level of the Canvas instance, then navigated to Settings, and it was there.  Also, needed to add this via XML post, not via URL.  It all worked great!
Good to hear Eric you got it up and running.
Great tool, I wish they use the RTL version. (which I know they have :-)
Great!, but (In Moodle) I am unable to reset the selected YouTube video. How do I do that?
Works great (no Moodle)
works great, great resource
Great app! easy to integrate, goes right on the course navigation without issues
This LTI app has greatly increased student satisfaction by facilitating access to course materials through Canvas, without requiring separate logins or web site visits.

I tried to contact WebAssign to find out how to develop the LTI and this is the response I received back from them:

Thanks for your email.  I am sorry to tell you this, and it is true that we are listed as LMI compliant, but that is not for Canvas, but for Blackboard.  We are an affiliate of LMS,and they can provide a link to WebAssign, but it will not serve as a single-sign-on to WebAssign. WebAssign only interfaces with Blackboard or Shib, not Canvas.

If you have other questions, please contact us.

Regards,
Cynthia
WebAssign Support
Great tool - thanks!
The videos don't embed but rather just show a link to the video.

We love this tool!
I would like to recommend changing the icon to be a little different from the standard YouTube LTI icon.  Having this tool and YouTube on the the editor bar with the same icon can be confusing.

Tool will not allow querystring params to be passed (causes messy "Internal Server Error" on edu-apps.org.  Would be very helpful to us if this could be fixed (or instructions provided on how to work around).  Our domino server requires querystring elements.
TEST
